review: It doesn't always work properly, and it takes some tinkering to be used to its full potential, but you can't beat the price.  The chromecast has changed the way I interact with essentially everything in my house that is connected to my network.  If everything worked perfectly, I would pay over $100 for a device that does everything that this does.  At $30, I can easily overlook the glitches.

author: D. Fugate "sunnydf"

review: I got this for my husband as a Christmas gift and our whole family loves it! We watch mostly Netflix, Hulu Plus and HBOgo for our source of entertainment rather than anything that's on TV/cable (and we eliminated the big package cable deals which often has 1000+ of channels with nothing to watch, ever). Often times though for movie nights we would squish together and try to watch it on the iPad or even a smartphone... Due to a big move that we are still unpacking from and having our "entertainment gadgets" still boxed up, that was our only option... We no longer need to squeeze together to stare at a small screen and that's a HUGE relief. This was so easy to set up and SO easy to connect to! I am truly satisfied with my purchase! I honestly do not write reviews often... Once in awhile I might to warn other consumers against a certain product or a seeker... But if you are considering it and you already watch a lot of streaming videos, this is a great little gadget!
